node.title: Saudi Man Arrested in Paris in 2018 Slaying of Washington Post Journalist Jamal Khashoggi
node.alt: A man was arrested in Paris in the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
node.description: Saudi Arabia has said that the man "has nothing to do with the case in question."
node.content:
["A Saudi Arabian man was arrested Tuesday in Paris, France, in the 2018 slaying of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi.", "Khalid Aedh al-Otaibi was arrested attempting to board a flight from Paris to Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, according to French authorities. Reportedly a former Saudi Royal Guard, al-Otaibi is alleged to be a member of a secret hit squad known for silencing dissidents of Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman.", "Khashoggi, a Saudi-born columnist, wrote numerous pieces for the Post that were critical of bin Salman's regime.", "Khashoggi was last seen in October 2018 at the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, Turkey. He was allegedly ambushed upon entering the building and quietly executed by a team of assassins, and his body has never been found.", "Despite this, the government of Saudi Arabia insisted that it had nothing to do with Khashoggi's murder.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated with additional information.", "", "
A man was arrested in Paris in the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
"]
